If the light is to the right of an object, the shadow will be to the left. If the light is in front of an object, the shadow will be behind it. If the light is above the object, the shadow is cast downwards onto the surface below.
The horizontal position of the shadow relative to the object is primarily determined by the horizontal position of the light source relative to the object.
In the provided image, the shadows (A, B, C, D) are cast on the ground near their respective objects.
